summary.p: The Ākhyātacandrikā is a lexicon of Sanskrit verbs, which is a departure for Sanskrit lexicography, which usually deals in nouns. This manuscript contains only the first kāṇḍa of the text. The first two verses at the beginning of this manuscript are not attested in the printed edition or in other manuscripts.

Although the manuscript is written in Grantha script, a blessing at the beginning is in Nandināgarī script, and the title is written on the cover folios in both Devanāgarī and Roman transliteration. The many scripts in use here testify to the many cultures that this manuscript has been embedded in.
The verso of the title folio contains an uninked line that is difficult to decipher.

msItem.title: Ākhyātacandrikā prathamakāṇḍa
msItem.author: Bhaṭṭamalla
msItem.incipit:
avalaṃbe khilālaṃbalaṃbodarapadadvayaṃ | yadālaṃbyāvilaṃbe na labhate laṃ budhaḥ śriyaṃ | 1 | vāṇī kalyāṇi kalyāṇaśreṇī niśreṇisaṃstave | madīryya
rasanāvedyāṃ vibhareṣṭārjje dāyinī | 2 | bhūvāryyādiprakṛtaye puruṣatrayamurttaye | sadākhyātapadāyāsmai parasmā ātmane namaḥ | 3 |
msItem.explicit:
― atra bhāvavikārāṇāṃ dhiyām i
cchādikarmaṇāṃ | vācān tatsaṃgatānāñ ca paryyāyaḥ prāyajñarīritāḥ | ❈ |

extent.measure: 2 front cover folios, 1-6, back cover folio

decoNote.desc: On 3r, a puṣpikā in the left margin.

additions.desc: On the title folio and the back cover, the number XVI in Roman numerals.
On the title folio, Akhyātachandrikā in Roman transliteration, with what seems to be the same in Grantha script.
On the back cover, Akhiathachandrika in transliteration and ākhyātacandrikā in Devanāgarī.
On 1r, śubham astu in Nandināgarī script.

binding.p: Leaves used as covers. 160 mm between stringholes.

provenance.p: Number XVI in a group of manuscripts of unknown provenance, beginning with Sanscrit 1103 as number I (See Colas & Colas-Chuahan 1995, 92).
